Key Match Events: Mounie (50') scored for Benin, Olaitan (62' pen.) scored for Benin, Mounie (54') scored for Benin
Al Badri (9' pen.) scored for Libya, Shafshuf (13'), Mukhtar Al Shremi (45+3'), Al Badri (54'), Abo Shaalah (54'), Arteeba (60') scored for Libya
Pre-Game Insights: Benin boast the quality needed to get the job done here and we are tipping them to come away with a narrow victory at the Stade Felix Houphouet-Boigny.
Benin have enjoyed an impressive start to the World Cup qualifying campaign, claiming seven points from their four matches to sit third in Group C, only behind first-placed Rwanda on goal difference.
Libya remain well on course to secure a first-ever World Cup appearance as they sit second in Group D, level on seven points with Cape Verde and one point behind leaders Cameroon.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Benin and Libya return to action in Group D of the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations qualifiers when they go head to head at the Stade Felix Houphouet-Boigny on Tuesday.

This will be the first meeting between the two nations since November 2018, when the Mediterranean Knights picked up a 1-0 friendly victory, and they will both be looking to secure their first win of the campaign.
Others: Benin possible starting lineup: Dandjinou; Kiki, Verdon, Hountondji, Moumini; D'Almeida, Imourane, Dodo; Olaitan, Mounie, Tosin
Libya possible starting lineup: Al Wuhayshi; Elkouri, Yusuf, Erteiba, Al Mabrouk; Al Badri, Al Shreimy; Salama, Al Khoja, Al Gleib; Krawaa
